summary: The APUS Student Service Centre is offering various cost-saving services including cheap printing, a cozy hangout space, and coffee/tea. The centre will host a series of events this fall to support students in their post-secondary education experience.
title: APUS Student Service Centre - Fall Events and Services

summary: The Association of Part-Time Undergraduate Students (APUS) is hiring a Financial Coordinator responsible for bookkeeping, accounting, banking, and preparing budgets and audits. Interested candidates should apply by sending their resume before the deadline.
title: Job Opening: Financial Coordinator at APUS

summary: The APSS is launching its mentorship program for the 2024-2025 academic year, aimed at connecting first and second-year political science students with upper-year mentors. This program offers valuable insights into POL courses, study tips, and networking opportunities, while mentors can gain recognition and enhance their mentoring skills.
title: APSS Mentorship Program Applications Open

summary: The Chem Club and Eng Soc are hosting an event to address academic concerns and foster community within the class. Students are encouraged to run for class representative positions, with open opportunities available.
title: Chem Club and Eng Soc Class Rep Elections

summary: The NSSA is hiring two second-year representatives for their executive team. Students are encouraged to apply by filling out the nomination form available in the linktree.
title: NSSA Second-Year Representative Nominations Open

summary: The NSA Super Eagles soccer team is starting their season on September 22nd, running every Sunday from 6 PM to 9:45 PM until November 10th. Players can sign up on IMLeagues to join the team.
title: Join the NSA Super Eagles Soccer Team!

summary: The event is the first gym session for new recruits of the dragon boat team, starting on September 11th, 2024, after their return from the world championships in Italy.
title: 2024-2025 Fall Semester Gym Schedule Kickoff

summary: NAUS is recruiting for the 2024-25 Executive Team, seeking candidates for various positions including 2nd-Year Representatives, Graphic Designers, VP Communications, and Secretary. Applications are due by September 20 at 11:59 PM.
title: NAUS Executive Team Recruitment

summary: Applications for the University of Toronto Relay For Life Executive Team are now open, with a deadline of September 25th at 11:59 PM. The event aims to unite individuals to fight cancer and create meaningful experiences.
title: University of Toronto Relay For Life Executive Team Applications Open

summary: The UTIHI is hiring for various volunteer executive team positions for the 2024-2025 academic year. Applications are open until September 30, 2024, and will be reviewed on a rolling basis. The event encourages individuals passionate about healthcare to apply.
title: UTIHI Executive Team Hiring Event

summary: Join SMC at the Toronto FC game against Columbus for an exciting match. Tickets are available for $15.
title: Toronto FC vs Columbus Game Night

summary: A mobile petting zoo visited St. Mike’s Quad, allowing students to interact with various animals including chickens, ducks, goats, and rabbits. The event was co-sponsored by the Community Wellness manager and SMCSU, and featured participation from the Dean of Students.
title: Mobile Petting Zoo at St. Mike’s Quad

summary: The event is an announcement for club recognition applications that are now open. Students are encouraged to apply before the deadline of September 22, 2024, at 11:59 PM.
title: Club Recognition Applications Open

summary: Join the CSU for a fun Photo Scavenger Hunt during Grow Week from September 9-13. Capture 7 moments at Grow Week events and submit your photos for a chance to win one of three $40 gift cards to the UofT Bookstore or Uber Eats. The first three submissions will win prizes!
title: CSU Grow Week Photo Scavenger Hunt

summary: WiCS is hiring for associate positions across all teams. Applications are open until September 15th at 11:59 PM. Interested candidates can find the application link in the bio and are encouraged to reach out with any questions.
title: WiCS Hiring Event

summary: UDesign is hosting a second round of designer applications, providing an opportunity for designers to join the creative community and enhance their skills. Applications are due on September 7th at 6:00 PM.
title: UDesign Second Round Designer Applications

summary: The event is a climbing session at Basecamp Queen West, aimed at creating a friendly and low-pressure environment for climbers to meet and make new friends. Participants are encouraged to join for a session and connect with others.
title: Climbing and Community Night at Basecamp Queen West

summary: Watch the Yu-Gi-Oh World Championship Series finals.
title: Yu-Gi-Oh WCS Finals Viewing Event

summary: Support Ryan's team at the YuGiOh Worlds Semi-Finals event.
title: YuGiOh Worlds Semi-Finals

summary: Join us for two fun art games and activities on our Discord server, including gartic phone and a collaborative drawing canvas. It's a great way to socialize and meet new people during the busy start of the school year!
title: Art Games on Discord: Socialize and Create!

summary: The Women’s Health Collective is accepting applications for its mentorship program, inviting both mentors and mentees to apply. Mentees should be first or second-year undergraduate students interested in women's health careers, while mentors should be third or fourth-year students with relevant experience. The application deadline is September 30th at 11:59 PM EST.
title: Women’s Health Collective Mentorship Program Applications Open

summary: The Industry Mentorship Program pairs University of Toronto students with professionals in various fields, offering personalized guidance, career development, and networking opportunities. Applications for mentees are open until September 20, 2024.
title: Industry Mentorship Program 2024-2025: Mentee Applications Open

summary: Join us for a morning run of 8k to La Gloria Mexican Coffee, with discounts for UTRC members.
title: Morning Run to La Gloria Mexican Coffee

summary: The event is the first run of the semester, welcoming participants of all paces to join for a 5k run. Attendees are advised to meet at the UC steps, and there will be no bag storage available.
title: First Run of the Semester

summary: UT-SAMA is holding elections for two Lower Year Representatives for the 2024-2025 year. First and second-year students are encouraged to apply, with sign-ups closing on September 27th at 11:00 PM. A public election will follow the sign-up period.
title: Lower Year Rep Election at UT-SAMA

summary: Participate in a marketing survey for a chance to win one of four $25 Amazon gift cards. The survey takes less than 5 minutes to complete and must be submitted by the deadline on September 16 at 5pm EST.
title: Marketing Survey for a Chance to Win a $25 Gift Card

summary: The event is a kickoff meeting for new and returning members of the Robosoccer team, marking the start of a new year.
title: Robosoccer Kickoff Meeting

summary: The Autonomous Rover Team (A.R.T.) is hosting an information session for prospective general members to learn about joining their team for the 2024-25 academic year. The team focuses on robotics and is preparing for the Intelligent Ground Vehicle Competition (IGVC) in June. Interested individuals can apply until September 11th, 2024.
title: A.R.T. Info Session and Recruitment

summary: The Autonomous Rover Team (A.R.T) is seeking applicants for the Software Lead position. Candidates should have proficiency in Python/C++, experience with PyTorch/TensorFlow, and an interest in ROS. The team competes in the Intelligent Ground Vehicle Competition (IGVC) every June.
title: A.R.T Software Lead Recruitment

summary: 6IX-PAC is recruiting passionate leaders and general members for their Algorithm and Electrosense teams. Interested individuals can apply through the link in their bio before the deadline.
title: 6IX-PAC Recruitment Drive

summary: UTMIST is hiring for various positions related to Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence for the 2024-2025 academic year. Applications are due on September 23rd at 11:59 PM EST and will be reviewed on a rolling basis. Opportunities include roles such as ML Developer, ML System Design Developer, and more. This is a chance to gain hands-on experience, mentorship, and the opportunity to present work at conferences.
title: UTMIST Hiring for 2024-2025: Join the ML & AI Community!

summary: UTMIST is conducting its second round of recruitments for various positions including Graphic Design Director, Digital Media Operations Director, and Technical Writers. Applications are due on September 16th at 11:59 PM EST and will be reviewed on a rolling basis. This is an opportunity to join a large community focused on Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence at the University of Toronto.
title: UTMIST Second Round Recruitments

summary: UTMIST is conducting a second round of hiring for various associate and director positions for the 2024-2025 academic year. Applications are due on September 16th at 11:59 PM EST, with a rolling review process. Opportunities include roles in marketing, logistics, and internal affairs.
title: UTMIST 2024-2025 Hiring Round Announcement

summary: This event is the fourth week of a series called 'Sunday Sketches', focusing on artistic illustrations that inspire curiosity and a love for science, particularly in the field of synthetic biology.
title: Sunday Sketches: Week 4 - Inspiring Science Through Art

summary: The event is part of a weekly series called 'Sunday Sketches' where illustrations related to science are shared to inspire curiosity and creativity in synthetic biology.
title: Sunday Sketches: Week 3

summary: The University of Toronto Global Medical Training Team is recruiting for various key roles including Finance Co-Directors, a Creative Co-Director, a Trip Co-Director, and several Associates. This is an opportunity for passionate individuals to enhance their skills and gain leadership experience.
title: Join the UofT Global Medical Training Team - Recruitment Open!

summary: The Iron Dragons team concluded their water season by competing at the Club Crews World Championships in Ravenna, Italy, where they achieved multiple medals in various categories. The event marked the culmination of a challenging season filled with hard work and dedication.
title: Iron Dragons Shine at Club Crews World Championships

summary: Join Blue Sky Solar Racing for a General Info Session to learn about opportunities in aerodynamics, mechanical, strategy, and software teams. Attendance is mandatory for all interested in becoming part of the Gen 12 team.
title: Blue Sky Solar Racing General Info Session

summary: Join us for an open mat and women's class at Studio A. Registration is required each week, and the event is free for students or anyone with a Hart House membership. Sign up through the link in our bio.
title: Open Mat & Women's Class at Studio A

summary: Auditions for Skule Nite 2T5 are being held on multiple dates in September. Participants can audition in pairs, either by signing up with a friend or being paired at the audition. The auditions are open to everyone interested in acting.
title: Skule Nite 2T5 Auditions Announcement

summary: The event is a recruitment drive for various roles including Executive, Crew, and Marketing positions for Skule Nite 2T5. Applications are due by September 25 at 11:59 PM.
title: Skule Nite 2T5 Recruitment Drive

summary: The event is a series of auditions and information sessions for Skule Nite 2023, including cast and crew opportunities. Key dates for auditions are provided, and attendees are encouraged to sign up for mailing lists for further updates.
title: Skule Nite 2023 Audition and Info Sessions

summary: The PhySU Executive Office Hours provide an opportunity for students to resolve physics-related queries or engage in casual conversations with the executive team. These hours are available both in person and on Discord for the Fall 2024-25 academic year.
title: PhySU Executive Office Hours Kickoff

summary: The 3rd Annual Quantum Student Conference and Q-SITE Hacks will take place, welcoming students from all academic backgrounds to participate in various activities and networking opportunities.
title: 3rd Annual Quantum Student Conference + Q-SITE Hacks

summary: A convention for students featuring a 50% discount on entry. The event will include 8 hours of panels, workshops, conferences, and activities in Spanish, with 62 top speakers sharing valuable knowledge to inspire attendees in Canada.
title: Conexiones Latinas Student Convention

location: Student Commons Room B120, 230 College St.
summary: An event where Googlers share their experiences and insights about being a software engineer at Google, providing a unique perspective on the engineering culture at the company.
title: Life of a Software Engineer: A Google Event

summary: The HBSU is inviting applications for Year Representative positions. Interested candidates can apply by the deadline of September 20, 2024, at 11:59 PM. The event encourages students to get involved in the executive team, with specific positions available for 1st, 2nd, and Upper Year Reps.
title: HBSU Year Representative Nominations Open

summary: Health Perspectives is seeking to hire an editorial team for the 2024-2025 academic year, including positions for Senior Editors, Junior Editors, a Layout Editor, and a Director of Engagement. Interested students are encouraged to apply by the deadline.
title: Join the Health Perspectives Editorial Team!

summary: The Health Studies Students’ Union is seeking candidates for eight positions on their Directionary Team, including representatives for each year and members at large. This is a great opportunity for students interested in gaining experience in executive roles.
title: Health Studies Students' Union Directionary Team Recruitment

summary: The Health Studies Students' Union is opening applications for their mentorship program for the 2024-2025 school year. First-year and second-year students are encouraged to apply for guidance in their program and career paths. Each mentee will be paired with an upper-year student and an alum from the Health Studies program.
title: Health Studies Mentorship Program Applications Open

summary: The Health Studies Students’ Union is hosting office hours where students can meet executive members, ask questions about the program, and connect with peers. Office hours will be available in-person and online on Tuesdays.
title: Health Studies Students' Union Office Hours

summary: An open house event for the European Affairs program, featuring presentations, pizza, and a prize raffle, providing an opportunity to learn more about the program and interact with professors and students.
title: European Affairs Open House

summary: The ESSA Journal, Messages in the Media, is seeking a new editor. Applications are due by September 30th at 11:59 PM.
title: Call for Editor: Messages in the Media Journal
